title: Tbird 115.4.1 (64-bit) Default Column View keeps reverting
content:
I've had this problem since Supernova came out and it drives me nuts.

It has nothing to do with sorting or threading. I've read dozens and dozens of support threads about that. This problem has nothing to do with that.

Issue: There does not seem to be a way to force TB to use a default user-defined column view. The way *I* set up my columns is: Star/Attachments/From/Recipient/Thread/Subject/Received/Size. Other users will have their own preference on which columns to display in which order. I know I can change the displayed columns and replicate that to existing folders, cascading down for the account view. That's great.

However, whenever I create a new folder or change the name of a folder it will revert back to showing the columns TB used before. Same when I move a folder from one subfolder to another (which I suppose amounts to changing the name, in a way)

I wish there were a default I could set so that ANY new folder I create wherever in the account will have the same columns displayed. And that the columns displayed will stay the same when I change name of a folder.

I've also looked for an add-on that might accomplish this but could not find.

title: You need to update Thunderbird - I need to be able to designate a different smtp/outgoing server setting for each email account
content:
I used to be able to use any of my logins for my email domain/provider for sending outgoing emails.

Now the account email used to authenticate the smtp client has to match the "from" for the emails. For the six email accounts that I currently am managing in Thunderbird, that means I have to go in to my account settings and change/verify a different outgoing email account every time I try to send an email message.

You need to change it so in each account setting, you can specify which smtp setting is used for that email account, instead of having smtp set up as a single, separate entity.
